attributes.action: “Citizenship is a privilege not a Right”
attributes.additional_details:
When an individual commits serious criminal offences that cause death or serious damage, then the Home Office must have the absolute right to revoke that individual’s citizenship and deport them back to their country of origin.

Cynically employing human rights legislation and the judicial process to prevent deportation are unacceptable for an individual who has used their freedom of choice to contravene the law and abuse the privileges of citizenship.
